tweets.html:
Saw The Help. Really made me think. About how cool it would be to have a full time maid. Did I get the right message from this movie?

— Franklin Hardy (@franklinhardy) January 13, 2012

The primary lesson I learn from shows like The Good Wife, Boss and House of Lies is how much I would suck at any of these jobs.

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) January 13, 2012

First Take discussing ESPN's role in Tebowmania is a little like North Korea holding a forum on freedom of the press.

— Richard Deitsch (@richarddeitsch) January 13, 2012

Actual TLC special airing Sunday: "World's Smallest Storm Chaser." Someday this network is going to be revealed to be a big prank, right?

— Andy Dehnart (@realityblurred) January 13, 2012

Walking Dead showrunner @GlenMazzara promises that when he hits 5,000 followers he will reveal which character is secretly a vampire.

— Shawn Ryan (@ShawnRyanTV) January 13, 2012

"SNL hasn't been funny since [year I had no responsibilities & could joyfully watch at my leisure]. But [undeniably talented person]'s ok."

— Abbi Crutchfield (@curlycomedy) January 13, 2012

From @TVandDinners commenters: "Everytime I think I know what's going on in this show, someone finds a new way to use a kitchen knife." #TVD

— Holly Jolly Christmas (@hollye83) January 13, 2012

Day 10 with no TV. Just started reading a dog-eared copy of Martin Chuzzlewit and emptying the drinks cabinet of the stuff nobody touches

— Sarah Bowden (@sarahjockeyclub) January 13, 2012

speaking of Downton Abbey...anyone wanna set me up with Mr. Bates? Thanks. Byeee.

(PS no mister bates/masturbates jokes or I block u)

— Morgan Murphy (@morgan_murphy) January 13, 2012

Just drank a can of Dr. Pepper 10 and yelled "Show me your tits" to everyone inside the Port Authority men's room. Now I'm talking to cops.

— Dave Hill (@mrdavehill) January 13, 2012

Not feeling well. What's the cutoff date for "In Memoriam" at the Oscars?

— Albert Brooks (@AlbertBrooks) January 13, 2012

On a scale of 1-10, how much do we think Ben McKenzie hated Mischa Barton?

— Cory Barker (@corybarker) January 13, 2012

To my 2nd Mom, Victoria Lord Gordon Riley Burke Buchanan Buchanan Carpenter Davidson Banks, you will always be in my heart #OLTL

— Bethany Morrow (@Flyforluv) January 13, 2012

ONE LIFE TO LIVE ends today. Taking a page from Victoria Lord's book and letting one of my alters deal with this pain. Meet Sassie everyone!

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) January 13, 2012

Is there more #OLTL in heaven? Someone please tell me there is more #OLTL in heaven!

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) January 13, 2012

#OLTL I vote for Destiny's child name to be Asa Raheem.

— Jillian (@jillianbowe) January 13, 2012

Alison Perkins better be reading to Fronsie, tied up with a apple stuck in his mouth. #OLTL

— Jamey_Giddens (@Jamey_Giddens) January 13, 2012

"I love you, Red." What a beautiful gift that ending was for fans of #OneLifetoLive. I'll miss afternoons in Llanview more than I can say.

— Meg Masters (@MegMasters) January 13, 2012

The Revolution commercial over the credits of the #OLTL finale make me wanna cut a bitch. Good thing I can't drive over to ABC today.

— ishira kumar (@ishirakumar) January 13, 2012

ABC - The Grinch Who Stole Our Stories. #EndofaSoapOpERA #OLTL

— ishira kumar (@ishirakumar) January 13, 2012

Can't wait til I start hearing rumors about a One Life to Live movie. #fortyfourseasonsandamovie

— Chris Becker (@crsbecker) January 14, 2012

The Napoleon Dynamite TV show is so forgettable that I can't even muster the energy to pan it.

— MZS (@mattzollerseitz) January 13, 2012

By, the way, the consensus is that Ben McKenzie REALLY hated Mischa Barton.

— Cory Barker (@corybarker) January 14, 2012

pretty much everything i watch nowadays is methadone for "mad men." march 25 cannot get here fast enough.

— javi grillo-marxuach (@OKBJGM) January 14, 2012

Californiiaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa Hereee we commeeeeeeeeeeee ! #BestThemeSongEver #

— Adam Wright (@TVDoneWright) January 14, 2012

Just found out that Diabetes has Paula Deen.

— Scott Chernoff (@ScottChernoff) January 13, 2012

Paula Deen has Type Two irony.

— Travon Free (@Travon) January 13, 2012

Paula Deen reacts to Diabetes by embracing healthy organic plant-based diet. Aw, just kiddin.' She's gonna sell pills.

— John Fugelsang (@JohnFugelsang) January 14, 2012

Did anyone else notice Paula Deen announced she had Diabetes & Hostess cakes went bankrupt in the same week?

— John Fugelsang (@JohnFugelsang) January 14, 2012

And we live in a world where #Rob draws a 4.1 in the 18-49 demo.

— Lacey Rose (@LaceyVRose) January 13, 2012

You can't jump off a ledge because 13.5 million people watched Rob, you guys. We need you to push THOSE people off a ledge. Stay focused!

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) January 13, 2012

Susan Lucci will host a series on ID called "Deadly Affairs," which is either unbearably cheesy or kind of brilliant. #orboth #TCA12

— Rick Porter (@rickporter) January 13, 2012

Starz' ChrisAbrecht ordered a drama FROM BenSilverman+HarveyWeinstein. Frankly, I'd prefer a comedy ABOUT Chris,Ben+Harvey working together.

— Lacey Rose (@LaceyVRose) January 13, 2012

Coming up HBO @ TCA: That's where all the snark & scorn of the last 7 days turns into overglowing, reverentially hyperbolic tweets of praise

— bigTVfan (@BigTVFan) January 13, 2012

Looking forward to the "Bad Boys of HBO" panel later today. Wait. What? Oh. #TCA12

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) January 13, 2012

"Was this show a revenge on 'Sex and The City'?" Oh crap. Is Emily Thorne in this show? #TCA12

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) January 13, 2012

I feel the need to tweet every word Judd Apatow says, just so he knows I'm not writing my Ricky Gervais story.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) January 13, 2012

"I'm a man. My career started with my own genitals." Judd on his recent commitment to female-driven comedy.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) January 13, 2012

If suddenly seeing "Judd Apatow's genitals" on your screen 15 times doesn't convince you of the value of Twitter, I can't help you. #TCA12

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) January 13, 2012

"Besides the hand job jokes, what else will guys like about this show?" That question just happened, people. #Girls #TCA12 #headdesk

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) January 13, 2012

It's a powder keg here at the #tca12 as "Rob's" big debut ratings come in. I expect the Langham hotel to ignite any moment. TV CRITIC RIOT!

— Michael Schneider (@franklinavenue) January 13, 2012

You know you're in an HBO session when there are naked women in a sizzle reel for a Hemingway movie. #tca12 #papacanyouhearme

— TV MoJoe (@TVMoJoe) January 13, 2012

"Hemingway & Gellhorn" is NOT a quirky TNT drama about mismatched writing partners who wind up solving crimes on the side. #tca12

— Michael Schneider (@franklinavenue) January 13, 2012

Nicole Kidman just apologized for swearing as she recounted a quote. Oh, that's adorable for this crowd.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) January 13, 2012

Last HBO panel of the day is for David Milch's "Luck." Accordingly, I expect the panel to mumble and/or talk in jargon I don't understand.

— Roger Catlin (@rcatlin) January 13, 2012

Someone posits a world in which #Luck could be done for broadcast and I am trying not to laugh. #TCA12

— Alyssa Rosenberg (@AlyssaRosenberg) January 13, 2012

Nick Nolte appears to be in character. I hope he talks to us like we are mystical horses. He is treating Dustin Hoffman like one. #TCA12

— Alyssa Rosenberg (@AlyssaRosenberg) January 13, 2012

"That was the thinnest applause I've ever heard." - Dustin Hoffman, discovering the pleasures of TCA, where we don't clap. It was HBO folks.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) January 13, 2012

"I didn't even get a laugh for that." - Hoffman, discovering we don't laugh a lot either.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) January 13, 2012

We've bored Nick Nolte. Closed eyes & almost dozed off during #HBO session on #Luck. We must pay for not clapping when he walked in. #tca12

— Susan Young (@Suetube) January 13, 2012

Nick Nolte's voice emerges from deep in the Earth's core, rumbling through layers of magma and rock. #TCA12

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) January 13, 2012

Nick Nolte is sober, but his voice is smoking four cigars and drinking a gallon of whiskey as we watch. #TCA12

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) January 13, 2012

Nick Nolte: The original Charlie Sheen. Sans medication. #tca12

— TV MoJoe (@TVMoJoe) January 13, 2012

If you play Nick Nolte's voice backwards and sped-up, it's Dakoda Fanning reciting Shakespeare. #TCA12

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) January 13, 2012

When Nolte puts his head down and we can't see his eyes, I feel like he's communicating with a parallel-universe #TCA12

— Emily Yoshida (@emilyyoshida) January 13, 2012

Nick Nolte's voice has been places -- dark places -- and done things -- bad things. #TCA12

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) January 13, 2012

I can do a lotta things but I can't transcribe David Milch.

— Diane Gordon (@thesurfreport) January 13, 2012

tweets.author_name: Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars
tweets.html:
Oh shit, @MattIGN just realized no one has asked Dustin Hoffman what he thinks of Work It!

— Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars (@TheEricGoldman) January 13, 2012

I had to miss the Titanic session for Nat Geo. Pretty sure I know how that one ends.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) January 13, 2012

You haven't lived til you've heard Morgan Freeman say -- even repeat -- "inculcate." Trust me. #tca12

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) January 13, 2012

Coming up: OWN, Animal Planet, TLC. Also known as: My first mid-day margarita.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) January 13, 2012

OWN: Oprah would love to be here, but she's run off with James Cameron. Or would have if cable channels coordinated excuses. #TCA12

— Ellen Gray (@elgray) January 13, 2012

Biggest lie of the TCA press tour: "Oprah wishes she could be here." #shehatesus #TCA12

— Scott D. Pierce (@ScottDPierce) January 13, 2012

#tca12 Clip shown of #Oprah walking on fire at #OWN session. Nothing of Peter Liguori being thrown under a bus

— Bill Brioux (@BillBriouxTV) January 13, 2012

UPN would like to offer Nick Nolte a five-night-a-week talk show, sight unseen. #upn

— UPN (@upntweets) January 13, 2012

Serious #TCA question: why is not okay to clap for panels but it's okay to groan?

— Danielle Turchiano (@danielletbd) January 13, 2012

Admit it, critics, "Homeboys in Outer Space" and "Desmond Pfeiffer" are looking pretty good right about now.

— UPN (@upntweets) January 13, 2012

Time for TLC at #TCA12. I wonder what fresh hell they will unleash on us now?

— Andy Dehnart (@realityblurred) January 13, 2012

Longest distance between two points: straight line between TLC and its orig. name, The Learning Channel. #TCA12

— Brad Oswald (@BradOswald) January 13, 2012

Niecy Nash's new TLC series described as "docu-sitcom," a phrase I hear as "FAKE FAKE FAKE FAKE."

— Andy Dehnart (@realityblurred) January 13, 2012

Sorry Animal Planet, but a panel about a show about making fish tanks is not gonna cut it this late in the TCA game. #punchy

— Maggie Furlong (@MaggieFurlong) January 13, 2012

Penguins! Discovery showing us a clip from "Frozen Planet," narrated by Alec Baldwin. But, penguins! #TCA12

— Rick Porter (@rickporter) January 13, 2012

Awww. They should have showed these pictures of polar bear cubs before the 2 Broke Girls session. (And then after, too.)

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) January 13, 2012

This is apparently the TCA where my critic friends hate people but love animals.

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) January 13, 2012

So @KeithOlbermann isn't at #TCA12 because he's on vacation. His vacation has consisted of angry tweeting. That's what #TCA12 is, KO!

— Kate Aurthur (@KateAurthur) January 13, 2012

Gore is here for Current, but all my questions are about "Futurama." #TCA12

— Alan Sepinwall (@sepinwall) January 13, 2012

Holy shit, Al Gore just said "sizzle reel." #TCA12

— Kate Aurthur (@KateAurthur) January 13, 2012

In Current session, half expected Al Gore to say, "You know WHY there's a Frozen Planet, right?"

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) January 14, 2012

AL GORE!!!!!

— Burley (@BurleytheKoala) January 14, 2012

Cenk Uygur is rambling, angrily. Wait, who is this guy again? Dude, pass us down your CV.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) January 14, 2012

Al Gore is talking now. This session is officially dead.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) January 14, 2012

Cenk Uygur is a bit like the Paul Fisher of progressive TV news. #remodeled #current

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) January 14, 2012

I might agree with some of what Cenk Uygur says, but I'd never watch his show: so, so annoying. Stop shouting at us! #TCA12

— Andy Dehnart (@realityblurred) January 14, 2012

Summary of Current #TCA12 session: (screaming at top of their lungs) "PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE pay attention to us."

— Ben Grossman (@grossman) January 14, 2012

Starz CEO Chris Albrecht asked if there's a punishment for running long. Me: "You have to produce the 2 Deadwood movies!" #TCA12

— Alan Sepinwall (@sepinwall) January 14, 2012

Reading the tweets about Starz's new show #MagicCity. This sounds like the worst show I will ever watch every episode of.

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) January 14, 2012

"BUT WILL THERE WILL BE MOAR BOOBS? #TCA12 questions, translated

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) January 14, 2012

On Starz, people also get naked in sci-fi relationships, medieval relationships, Chicago political relationships AND MORE!

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) January 14, 2012

Oh man. I don't wanna spoil what's going on in this scene. But Jesus Christ it's great. And MASSIVE. #Spartacus #TCA12

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) January 14, 2012

The clips we saw were basically dipped in buckets of blood, then poured out in slow-mo. So, show remains the same.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) January 14, 2012

TREND ALERT TREND ALERT NatGeo, TLC announce gypsy reality shows; gypsy character on Starz' MAGIC CITY. Your move, New York Times.

— Michael Schneider (@franklinavenue) January 14, 2012

Starz took the mic back before I got to ask what comes after sexy gladiators, sexy medievalists, sexy real estate deals and sexy sci-fi.

— Alyssa Rosenberg (@AlyssaRosenberg) January 14, 2012

A&E has announced a new series called Bates Motel, a prequel to Psycho but tragically not a reality show, like I initially thought/hoped.

— Andy Dehnart (@realityblurred) January 14, 2012

I'm assuming Lou Diamond Phillips doesn't stay in touch with Heidi and Spencer. But that's just an assumption.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) January 14, 2012

This episode is like a cosmic present for something I did right in a past life. #SPN

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) January 14, 2012

CAN I JUST KISS THE WRITER OF THIS EPISODE. #supernatural

— amy (@frostylowden) January 14, 2012

tweets.author_name: cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future
tweets.html:
Fringe gets all its ideas from As The World Turns. #truth

— cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future (@sarCCastro) January 13, 2012

@sarCCastro As the Worlds Turn?

— Poe Daar-meron (@AndrewDaar) January 13, 2012

That's an unacceptable outcome, #Fringe.

— mesk (@_mesk) January 14, 2012

Seriously, #Fringe? SERIOUSLY? WE'RE GOING TO DO THIS? THIS IS HOW WE'RE GOING TO DO THIS? FINE. JUST, FINE.

— Notorious RBF (@stringertheory) January 14, 2012

Seriously, the Nissan placement in Fringe makes me all warm/tingly. I love me a gratuitous product placement.

— Blerg (@MediaObsessed) January 14, 2012

Fauxlivia's bangs make Lea Michele's look good. #Fringe #Glee

— Evan Kirby (@evankirby) January 14, 2012

the last scene in last night's #fringe Nooooooo

— Melanie Bourdaa (@melaniebourdaa) January 14, 2012

I consider myself a fairly well-read, well-educated person. But I lack the vocabulary to adequately express my hatred for American Idol.

— Notorious RBF (@stringertheory) January 14, 2012

It's official -- Caroline has chemistry with EVERYONE. #TVD

— Vlada Gelman (@VladaGelman) January 14, 2012

Bigger insult: telling someone they Britta'd it, or that they pulled a Jerry? #Community #ParksAndRec

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) January 14, 2012

I'm officially in love with all the girls on #Community. Even @kenjeong.

Especially @kenjeong. pic.twitter.com/qi5ivXjj

— Nathan Fillion (@NathanFillion) January 14, 2012

@corybarker 3 words- Work. It. Movie. #2EpisodesAndATerribleMovie

— (((Andrew Rabin))) (@arrabin56) January 14, 2012

So what are we going to mail to ABC en masse to save Work It? Bras? Lipstick? Hardened feces? #SAVEWORKIT

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) January 14, 2012

I guess the lesson of this is that if you have a terrible sitcom, you should put it on CBS. #SaveWorkIt #Rob

— Person of Mattress (@digifreak642) January 14, 2012

Work It led me to sing Missy Elliot's Work It about 2300 times. Only lyrics I know: Work it, lemme see you work it, bamadan dig nana nana na

— kevinbiegel (@kbiegel) January 14, 2012

Damn! #WorkIt got cancelled, and it was just hitting it's creative stride!

— Evan Kirby (@evankirby) January 14, 2012

"Due to production needs, AMC will no longer present The Killing." Worst. TCA. Cop out. Ever. Tell Veena Sud we have long memories.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) January 14, 2012

Tweets by @rupertmurdoch often remind me of Steinbrenner on "Seinfeld." Wonder how he feels about soup in a bread bowl.

— Phil Rosenthal (@phil_rosenthal) January 14, 2012

tweets.author_name: The Ghost of Eric D. Snider Past
tweets.html:
Without fail, every time I think, "This is one of the weirdest things I've ever seen," I'm watching something Japanese.

— The Ghost of Eric D. Snider Past (@EricDSnider) January 14, 2012
